description.narrative: Output 1.2: Strengthened national capacity to deliver routine immunization and sustain polio certification status., which contributes to Immunization, Immunization (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Children, adolescents and women have equitable access to and use improved and quality, high-impact maternal, neonatal and child health interventions and adopt healthy life practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.2: Strengthened national capacity to deliver routine immunization and sustain polio certification status.

description.narrative: Nigeria set a target of 48% coverage for the main indicator DPT3 coverage by the end of 2019 and it was possible to achieve 50.1% based on the NDHS 2018 report, but the administrative coverage reported 83% (DHIS Oct 2019). The annual target for LGAs with 80% and above coverage was set as 31% and Nigeria achieved 36% by Q3 2019 (LQAS Q3 2019). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Months with stockout of DTP containing vaccine at the national level (Target: 0 month)
Children 0-59 months vaccinated with polio through a UNICEF-supported programme during campaigns
Availability of stocks of Polio vaccine (bOPV IPV) at national and subnational level for use in campaigns for at least 1 week before implementation
Availability of stocks of polio vaccine (IPV and bOPV) at national and subnational level for use in routine immunisation programmes for at least 6 months
Availability of stocks of polio vaccine (IPV and bOPV) at national and subnational level for use in routine immunisation programmes for at least 6 months
Effective vaccine management (EVM) composite country score
Country had no stock-out of DTP/Penta, Polio (OPV and IPV) and Tetanus Toxoid vaccines at district level
